Detailed Description

The main class representing a JSON value.

Each value can be either a string, number, true, false, null or one of the structure types object or array.

  • A string can be: "mystring".
  • A number may be: 4e-3 (0.004)
  • The literals are: true, false or null (note lower case).

An array is several values listed. The value may be another array or object.

 [ "value1", 12, false ]

 [ [ "valx1", "valx2" ], [ "valy1", "valy2" ] ]

An object is several values, identified by a string key. The value may be another array or object.

 {
   "key1" : "val1"
 }

 {
   "arr" : [1, 2, 3],
   "obj" :
   {
     "first"  : 1,
     "second" : 2,
     "third"  : 3
   }
 }
Examples:

doc-array.cpp, doc-basic.cpp, and doc-object.cpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Json::Value::Value ( std::string  json) throw (Json::Exception) [inline]

Parse a json string. This provides an easy to use interface to fetch values and structures.

Parameters:
jsonThe json object as a string.
Exceptions:
Json::ExceptionIf the string can not be interpreted as json.
Returns:
A representation of the json object.
Json::Value::~Value ( ) [inline]

Deletes this Value, and all values this may hold. If this, for example, is an array, it will loop over all the values the array holds and delete them one by one.

template<class T >
T Json::Value::get ( ) [inline]

Fetches the value, casted to class T. Unless needed for specific reasons (such as dynamic types), use the 'asT()' functions instead.

Exceptions:
std::bad_castIf the value cant be casted to T.
Returns:
The current value.
Json::Types Json::Value::getType ( ) [inline]

Get the type of this value,(e.g. JVARRAY or JVNUMBER). This can be used to determine which 'asT()' function you can use to retrieve the value.

Returns:
The type as defined by Json::Types
See also:
Json::Types
Examples:
doc-array.cpp.
bool Json::Value::isNull ( ) [inline]

Determines whether this JSON value is null or not. Only the JSON literal 'null' will be considered as null.

Returns:
True if JSON value is null, false otherwise.
Value Json::Value::operator[] ( const char *  key) [inline]

Fetches the value defined by 'key' in the Object this value represents.

Note:
This Json::Value must represent an object.
Parameters:
keyThe key to use to retrieve the value.
Returns:
The value identified by key.
Value Json::Value::operator[] ( int  key) [inline]

Fetches the value defined by key in the Array this value represents.

Note:
This Json::Value must represent an array.

The key is indexed from 0 to n-1, where n is the number of elements in the array. (see std::vector).

Parameters:
keyThe key to use to retrieve the value.
Returns:
The value identified by key.
